Ready2Move:
Vehicles are alligned, communications are checked.
Leader of platoon can now start moving

Tasks:
[DONE]
1) Defining inital state
The initial state has to take check if there is a person sitting
on the drivers' seat or the truck gets defined as the leader. It then has to
pass a command to the communications system to emit a message that this
truck gets defined as the leader.
Otherwise it has to wait for the message received by the commuications
system that a leader was found.

[DONE]
2) Defining communications diagram:
The communications diagram has to listen for messages (right now only for the
message that someone will be the leader) and pass events to the left state machine.
It also has to be able to transmit messages (right now only the message that someone
will be the leader).
[surrounding truck at behind]

Simulation definition

Truck - A process that contain a few thread (functionality run parallelly)


communication(send and receive medium) - ?






search leader - ?




connection - ?

Suggestion1 (Array-based)
location -
the main process (simulation) store the information of each truck in a list, including x,y values

Search - 
a truck (a process or thread ) read the truck list (that stored by main process) and find the closest one based on the location

Connection -
the main process (simulation) have a list of channel/array. when a truck become a leader, it will have it channel (from the channel list). once a follower found a leader, 
it will select the channel that match with the leader


Suggestion2 (MQTT)
location -

Search - 


Connection -

Suggestion3 (socket)
location -
a truck have two port (receive and transmit)/(leader/follower)
the y value is constant and x value is the port number

Search - 
a truck try to connect to the port number less than its port number. if no connection can be establish, it will become a leader. 
a thread from the truck process will always open a connection for another follower. That why it have two port

Connection -
establish during the search
Platoon network architecture (peer to peer)
